<item><title>The top iPhone and iPad apps on App Store</title><description>App Store Official Charts for the week ending November 3, 2014:</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/top-iphone-ipad-apps-app-store-173512065.html</link><pubDate>Tue, 04 Nov 2014 12:59:01 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">top-iphone-ipad-apps-app-store-173512065</guid></item><item><title>Jamala: Ukraine's Crimean Tatar with harrowing family tale</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/jamala-ukraines-crimean-tatar-harrowing-family-tale-072632171.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TDMpIhIpTBAYIEE0fnQUFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/c7e2538150205da80ae46a00d43a99051fdf062d.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="The Eurovision entry by Ukranian singer Jamala brings serious political and diplomatic undertones to the competition" align="left" title="The Eurovision entry by Ukranian singer Jamala brings serious political and diplomatic undertones to the competition" border="0" /></a>The lament entitled &quot;1944&quot; will be sung in Saturday&#039;s Eurovision grand final in Stockholm by 32-year-old Jamala, a member of the Muslim Tatar minority of Crimea, a Black Sea peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014. Jamala&#039;s words refer to the tragedy that befell her great-grandmother near the end of World War II, when Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin deported 240,000 Tatars -- almost the entire community -- to barren Central Asia and other far-flung lands.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/jamala-ukraines-crimean-tatar-harrowing-family-tale-072632171.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:26:32 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">jamala-ukraines-crimean-tatar-harrowing-family-tale-072632171</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TDMpIhIpTBAYIEE0fnQUFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/c7e2538150205da80ae46a00d43a99051fdf062d.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/jamala-ukraines-crimean-tatar-harrowing-family-tale-072632171.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/TDMpIhIpTBAYIEE0fnQUFA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/c7e2538150205da80ae46a00d43a99051fdf062d.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="The Eurovision entry by Ukranian singer Jamala brings serious political and diplomatic undertones to the competition" align="left" title="The Eurovision entry by Ukranian singer Jamala brings serious political and diplomatic undertones to the competition" border="0" /></a>The lament entitled &quot;1944&quot; will be sung in Saturday&#039;s Eurovision grand final in Stockholm by 32-year-old Jamala, a member of the Muslim Tatar minority of Crimea, a Black Sea peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014. Jamala&#039;s words refer to the tragedy that befell her great-grandmother near the end of World War II, when Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin deported 240,000 Tatars -- almost the entire community -- to barren Central Asia and other far-flung lands.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Eurovision, a well-oiled diplomatic machine</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/eurovision-well-oiled-diplomatic-machine-071621265.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AOidyVKj5IMhCJWytOYLrw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/307c512743a1aaa9992fbe7b7d719e882b886c65.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s Eurovision Song Contest in Sweden on Saturday" align="left" title="A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s Eurovision Song Contest in Sweden on Saturday" border="0" /></a>In an ideal world, the Eurovision Song Contest would be all about music and cross-border camaraderie. A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s final on Saturday in Sweden, homeland of inventor Alfred Nobel, who gave his name to the famous international peace prize. The European Broadcasting Union, which organises the contest, &quot;will never successfully depoliticise Eurovision,&quot; Jess Carniel, social scientist at the Australian University of Southern Queensland and a Eurovision specialist, explained to AFP.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/eurovision-well-oiled-diplomatic-machine-071621265.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:16:21 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">eurovision-well-oiled-diplomatic-machine-071621265</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AOidyVKj5IMhCJWytOYLrw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/307c512743a1aaa9992fbe7b7d719e882b886c65.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/eurovision-well-oiled-diplomatic-machine-071621265.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AOidyVKj5IMhCJWytOYLrw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/307c512743a1aaa9992fbe7b7d719e882b886c65.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s Eurovision Song Contest in Sweden on Saturday" align="left" title="A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s Eurovision Song Contest in Sweden on Saturday" border="0" /></a>In an ideal world, the Eurovision Song Contest would be all about music and cross-border camaraderie. A cast of hopeful artists from 26 countries will compete in this year&#039;s final on Saturday in Sweden, homeland of inventor Alfred Nobel, who gave his name to the famous international peace prize. The consequences may be less brutal now, but China&#039;s Communist authorities still impose strict controls and censorship. Jiang Zuhui, now 81, choreographed one of the most emblematic works of the Cultural Revolution era -- the &quot;Red Detachment of Women&quot; ballet.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/dance-music-mao-chinas-cultural-revolution-art-043053807.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:30:53 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">dance-music-mao-chinas-cultural-revolution-art-043053807</guid><media:content url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/v.zfgR6czXvyP7VAEnDsPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/ea72db80af33b1d9e4c32480b7d699ba98056c91.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/dance-music-mao-chinas-cultural-revolution-art-043053807.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/v.zfgR6czXvyP7VAEnDsPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/ea72db80af33b1d9e4c32480b7d699ba98056c91.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Performers dancing and singing during a Chinese national opera of the &quot;Red Detachment of Women&quot; in Haikou, south China&#039;s Hainan province" align="left" title="Performers dancing and singing during a Chinese national opera of the &quot;Red Detachment of Women&quot; in Haikou, south China&#039;s Hainan province" border="0" /></a>When the critical eye of Mao Zedong&#039;s wife fell upon a non-conforming artist during China&#039;s Cultural Revolution the assessment could be devastating. Foster noted &quot;drastic changes&quot; on film sets from her years as a child actor, when the only women on set were the make-up artists and the person playing her mother. Foster, 53, said the turbulent economy and changing technologies had left studio bosses more risk-averse than ever.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/jodie-foster-says-women-directors-seen-too-risky-130139697.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:49:45 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">jodie-foster-says-women-directors-seen-too-risky-130139697</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/.pXbyKkOabXPZie5kPes.A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/741efc99621c212b04dcf59ab28d73240691c95f.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/jodie-foster-says-women-directors-seen-too-risky-130139697.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/.pXbyKkOabXPZie5kPes.A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/741efc99621c212b04dcf59ab28d73240691c95f.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="US director Jodie Foster promotes &quot;Money Monster&quot; at the 69th Cannes Film Festival in southern France, on May 12, 2016" align="left" title="US director Jodie Foster promotes &quot;Money Monster&quot; at the 69th Cannes Film Festival in southern France, on May 12, 2016" border="0" /></a>Jodie Foster, who presented her first mainstream film as a director in Cannes Thursday, said many studio bosses still dismissed female filmmakers as &quot;too great a risk to take&quot;. Foster noted &quot;drastic changes&quot; on film sets from her years as a child actor, when the only women on set were the make-up artists and the person playing her mother. To mark the 200 years since England&#039;s Mary Shelley first imagined the ultimate horror story during a visit to a frigid, rain-drenched Switzerland, an exhibit opens in Geneva Friday called &quot;Frankenstein, Creation of Darkness&quot;. In the dimly-lit, expansive basement at the Martin Bodmer Foundation, a long row of glass cases holds 15 hand-written, yellowed pages from a notebook where Shelley in 1816 wrote the first version of what is considered a masterpiece of romantic literature.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/origin-frankenstein-exhibit-taps-angst-over-science-184906776.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:49:06 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">origin-frankenstein-exhibit-taps-angst-over-science-184906776</guid><media:content url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c0ydd67VwHK67igKk0d1eA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/8ead6ab7fe26255c5a45fbe20e6e7c0c48f65101.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/origin-frankenstein-exhibit-taps-angst-over-science-184906776.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c0ydd67VwHK67igKk0d1eA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/8ead6ab7fe26255c5a45fbe20e6e7c0c48f65101.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="A statue of Frankenstein&#039;s monster in Geneva" align="left" title="A statue of Frankenstein&#039;s monster in Geneva" border="0" /></a>Frankenstein, the story of a scientist who brings to life a cadaver and causes his own downfall, has for two centuries given voice to anxiety surrounding the unrelenting advance of science. Allen, 80, whose film &quot;Cafe Society&quot; had its premiere on Wednesday, was seated in the front row at the Cannes opening ceremony when the MC, French actor Laurent Lafitte, made a rape joke that drew gasps from the audience. Opinions were divided on whether the comment was directed at Allen -- who was never charged with the historic abuse accusations against him -- or director Roman Polanski who has been living in Europe to escape charges he raped a 13-year-old in the United States.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/rape-joke-sex-abuse-claims-haunt-woody-allen-085303031.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:44:38 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">rape-joke-sex-abuse-claims-haunt-woody-allen-085303031</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/SrdbTyNeD10jtL3Z2BYaHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/b5e703af60b9b77ede618d0b5a419e2609093f51.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/rape-joke-sex-abuse-claims-haunt-woody-allen-085303031.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/SrdbTyNeD10jtL3Z2BYaHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/b5e703af60b9b77ede618d0b5a419e2609093f51.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="US director Woody Allen and his wife Soon-Yi Previn arrive for the screening of his new film &quot;Cafe Society&quot; during the opening ceremony of the 69th Cannes Film Festival on May 11, 2016" align="left" title="US director Woody Allen and his wife Soon-Yi Previn arrive for the screening of his new film &quot;Cafe Society&quot; during the opening ceremony of the 69th Cannes Film Festival on May 11, 2016" border="0" /></a>Veteran director Woody Allen on Thursday said he was not offended by a rape joke in his presence at Cannes, where allegations he sexually abused his daughter returned to haunt him. Allen, 80, whose film &quot;Cafe Society&quot; had its premiere on Wednesday, was seated in the front row at the Cannes opening ceremony when the MC, French actor Laurent Lafitte, made a rape joke that drew gasps from the audience.
